[[עתמאל]] Nö:M 202; Eth tm4alm: As timâli, itimâli, ina timâli (Dl:158, 721); der. dub.; acc. to Me:Gr. Syr. 118 Kö:ii. 264 f. from Ar. mala0 II. prolongavit, IV. longam vitam concessit, malan0 tempus, 0lmalawa0ni the two times, i.e. night and day, in form an inf. of vi. tama0lin; hence prop. long time, (past) time, specialized to yesterday);—yesterday, but usually fig.= recently or formerly:
2Sa 15:20 [[תְּמוֹל בּוֹאֲךָ]] yesterday (=only lately) was thy coming, Job 8:9 [[תמול אנחנו]] (of) yesterday (Ges:§ 141 d) are we, Ps 90:4 (genit.) [[בְּיוֹם אֶתְמוֹל]].
